Introduction.text: Hi there ! Let's see how your computer considers images and discover the basics concepts behind computer vision. I hope you'll enjoy the ride !

Image histogram.text: Here it is ! A darker or under exposed image with its pixel intensity histogram.
Image histogram.text1: Here it is ! A lighter or over exposed image with its pixel intensity histogram.
Image histogram.text2: When you evenly distribute pixel intensities accross the possible range, you get a perfectly adjusted contrast. This is great to help the computer find interesting keypoints in your image !
Image histogram.text3: You can also look at it this way. If you get a straight line accross this figure, it means your histogram (of the previous side) is well equalized.

Convolution filtering.text: In image processing, a kernel, convolution matrix, or mask is a small matrix used for blurring, sharpening, embossing, edge detection, and more. This is accomplished by doing a convolution between the kernel and an image. The convolution filters use local neighbors to compute the weighted average, and each pixel is used multiple times by its neighbors. Whatch carefully the animation to understand what happens to an image uppon running a convolution filter on it.
